intro: Gomphia theophrasta, commonly known as the African orchid, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique, showy flowers that resemble a cluster of small, white orchids. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forests and rocky areas. Its roots are fibrous and adapted to retain moisture in its natural habitat. Gomphia theophrasta is valued not only for its ornamental appeal but also for its ecological role in supporting local biodiversity.
